newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: TEN CATE EXPECTS IMPROVEMENT TO CONTINUE.
newsitem.headline: TEN CATE EXPECTS IMPROVEMENT TO CONTINUE.

text.p: Textiles and plastics processor Koninklijke Ten Cate NV said on Friday it expected the gradual improvement in operations to continue through the rest of the year.
"The executive board expects, barring unforeseen circumstances, that the gradual improvement in operations will also be reflected in the full-year result over 1996," the company said in a statement.
The company said in March a further improvement of returns should be possible in 1996.
Ten Cate posted 1996 first-half net profit of 17.5 million guilders, a jump of 60 percent from 11 million guilders in the year-earlier half.
